paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted genetic variant information for the TTR gene, including penetrance data.

individual_records.phenotype_details: diagnosed with ventricular noncompaction by echocardiography, preserved ejection fraction
individual_records.evidence_sentence: Eventual genetic testing confirmed a TTR gene mutation associated with hereditary transthyretin amyloidosis.

functional_data.summary: The mutation weakens monomeric interactions, leading to tetramer dissociation and amyloid fibril accumulation.

variants.segregation_data: The variant is associated with hereditary transthyretin amyloidosis.
variants.additional_notes: The Val122Ile mutation is linked to a cardiac phenotype.
key_quotes: The Val122Ile mutation, prevalent in 3–4% of African Americans, leads to a cardiac phenotype.

patients.demographics: common in Sweden, Portugal, and Japan

functional_data.summary: The mutation is associated with polyneuropathy.

variants.segregation_data: The variant is associated with hereditary transthyretin amyloidosis.
variants.additional_notes: The Val30Met mutation is linked to polyneuropathy.
key_quotes: Val30Met, common in Sweden, Portugal, and Japan, is associated with polyneuropathy.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data for TTR variants were extracted successfully.
